data.title: When You Find the Girl of Your Dreams in the Arms of some Scotsmen from Hull
data.meta_description: "When You Find the Girl of Your Dreams in the arms of some Scotsmen from Hull" is a solo album released by Barry Wom. It is significant for being the first Rutle solo album to reach #1 in the charts. The title of the record along with the first song were inspired by the true events of Barry's...
data.text:
Released

27 March 1970

Recorded

14 January 1970

Genre

Rock

Length

59:56

Label

Rutle Corps

Next Barry album

Barry Cross The Mersey

"When You Find the Girl of Your Dreams in the arms of some Scotsmen from Hull" is a solo album released by Barry Wom. It is significant for being the first Rutle solo album to reach #1 in the charts.

Origins[]

The title of the record along with the first song were inspired by the true events of Barry's wedding, when he accidentally married the wrong woman, and found the right one in the arms of some Scots from Hull.

Track listing[]

"When You Find the Girl of Your Dreams in the Arms of Some Scotsmen from Hull (Without Her)"

"Rut Don't Rut Song"

"Fastest Growing Headache in the North"

"Back-Up Blues"

"Woman I Dislike"

"I'd Be Talking All The Lime"

"$50 Lawsuit"

"Wine, Women and Lord Happy Songs"

"I World Have You Any Mother Way"

"Rutter's Lounge"

"Wasting"

"Violent Homecoming"

"Boochy Boochy

"Denver Jam
